;In October 2023, the third "Belt and Road" International Cooperation Summit Forum was held in Beijing, which is also a commemoration of Special event for the 10th anniversary of the Belt and Road Initiative.

;

;The “One Belt, One Road” initiative is not just business exchanges, but also emphasizes cultural exchanges and people-to-people connections, which opens a window for Chinese social organizations to “go global”. In March 2015, the "Vision and Actions on Promoting the Joint Construction of the Silk Road Economic Belt and the 21st Century Maritime Silk Road" issued by the National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the Ministry of Commerce with the authorization of the State Council pointed out that people-to-people bonds are the key to the construction of the "Belt and Road" It is necessary to strengthen exchanges and cooperation among non-governmental organizations in countries along the route, focusing on grassroots people, and extensively carry out various charity activities such as education and medical care, poverty reduction and development, biodiversity and ecological environmental protection, so as to promote the improvement of production and living conditions in poverty-stricken areas along the route.

;

;Subsequently, the General Office of the Central Committee and the General Office of the State Council issued the "Notice on Promoting the Participation of Social Organizations in the Activities of International Non-Governmental Organizations" and "Opinions on Further Strengthening the Training and Promotion of Talents for International Organizations", actively advocating the participation of social organizations. International exchanges and strengthening international talent cultivation. In 2016, the "Opinions on Reforming the Management System of Social Organizations to Promote the Healthy and Orderly Development of Social Organizations" was released, further encouraging social organizations to "carry out external exchanges in an orderly manner" and "give full play to the important platform role of social organizations in non-governmental external exchanges."

;

;The first “Belt and Road” International Cooperation Summit Forum in 2017 officially launched the “Chinese Social Organizations Action Plan to Promote People-to-People Connectivity along the Belt and Road (2017-2020)” and the cooperation network of civil society organizations along the Silk Road. More than 160 Chinese and foreign non-governmental organizations have joined the cooperation network, and more than 90 Chinese organizations have joined the action plan.

;

;Many organizations stated that the “One Belt, One Road” initiative has a significant impact on their internationalization journey. "In the past, social organizations carried out international business independently based on their own business development. Now there are policies to clearly support and encourage going global. This difference is still very big." Secretary-General of China Rural Development Foundation (formerly China Poverty Alleviation and Development Foundation) Chen Hongtao said.

;

;According to statistics from the Ministry of Civil Affairs, my country currently has 51 registered international social organizations; since 2013, relevant work has been further accelerated, with a total of 24 international social organizations registered, accounting for 47% of the total. Chinese social organizations are not only going global, but also increasingly participating in the international governance system. In 2015, Professor Deng Guosheng of the School of Public Policy and Management at Tsinghua University conducted research on the “going global” strategy of Chinese social organizations. At that time, there were ;48; social organizations in China (including Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan) that had consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council. This number has now grown to 103.

;

;;Sail to the sea;

;

;Chinese social organizations "go global", and the China Rural Development Foundation can be regarded as one of the "first batch of institutions to eat crabs". The China Rural Development Foundation carried out de-administrative reforms in the late 1990s. In 2005, it began to explore international development. In 2007, it proposed an internationalization strategy for institutional development and began to go abroad.

;

;“Our internationalization can basically be divided into three stages: internationalization without going abroad, internationalization on a business trip, and resident internationalization.” Chen Hongtao introduced that internationalization without going abroad, For example, if you participated in international actions or international assistance before 2009, you would mainly donate money and materials through cooperation with other international organizations. In 2009, the International Development Department was established, with a dedicated team to carry out special projects. At this time, the domestic team was mainly responsible for traveling overseas to implement. In 2015, the China Rural Development Foundation officially registered and established offices in Myanmar and Nepal, marking the transformation from a local social organization in China to an international public welfare organization.

;

;Currently, the China Rural Development Foundation has 3 country offices and is carrying out projects in 7 other countries in a relatively stable and sustainable manner. Internationalization is written into the organization's vision, "to build an international public welfare platform that is more trustworthy, more worthy of expectation, and more worthy of respect." "One Belt, One Road" has also been included in the organization's charter, "responding to the 'Belt and Road' initiative and participating in international poverty reduction cooperation." and humanitarian aid”.

;

;The Amity Foundation, established in 1985, has been active in the field of international exchange and development. From "bringing in", such as introducing foreign teachers and introducing advanced concepts in the field of international development, to "going out" in 2009 and launching a series of international projects. From 2015 to 2019, the Amity Foundation successively set up African offices, international offices and Kenya offices in Ethiopia, Geneva, Switzerland, and Nairobi.

;

;Compared with the early institutions that were trying to cross the river by feeling their way through the river to explore “going out”, the pace of Chinese social organizations’ “going out” has accelerated since the “One Belt, One Road” initiative was proposed. The Red Cross Foundation of China closely follows the overall requirements of the country's "Belt and Road" construction and in accordance with the foreign aid work deployment of the Red Cross Society of China, and established the "Silk Road Fraternity Fund" in 2017. This fund is a "Belt and Road" public welfare fund, covering China's international humanitarian aid, state-supported private foreign aid, Chinese enterprises' "going global strategy", international volunteer services, etc. Relying on the partners of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement around the world, after the establishment of the special fund, the Chinese Red Cross Foundation quickly established an international working network to carry out projects along the “Belt and Road”.

;

;The “One Belt, One Road” initiative has also inspired more organizations that have been focusing on global issues since their establishment. The Beijing Pinglan Charity Foundation was established in April 2018. Since its establishment, it has actively participated in responding to domestic and foreign humanitarian crises, environmental crises and other emergencies. In 2019, the Beijing Pinglan Charity Foundation conducted preliminary research on the situation of Syrian refugees in Lebanon, set up a local office, and sent a working group to carry out humanitarian assistance work. ;In 2021; the Beijing Pinglan Charity Foundation’s Geneva office was established, with staff stationed there to carry out international exchanges and cooperation in the fields of humanitarian assistance and environmental protection.

;

;;Promoting "people-to-people connectivity";

;

;Chinese social organizations face far more complex situations and more severe tests than at home. However, as the world's No. 1 China, the two largest economies, is both a developing country, and its governance experience seems to be more "resonant" with that of less developed countries. "Compared with Western developed countries, China's social organizations' going global still has our own characteristics. "Professor Huang Haoming, Executive Director of the Hainan Asia Philanthropy Research Institute and Honorary Chairman of the China Association for the Promotion of International Non-Governmental Organization Cooperation, introduced. One of these characteristics is reflected in our culture of gratitude. "In the past, China was more of a recipient of foreign aid. Now we As we develop, we begin to go out and help other countries. As Mozi said, 'love universally' and 'not attack', and go out in a peaceful way. "The second is the awareness of equality and respect. "Because we ourselves are also developing countries, when we go to other less developed countries, we are not condescending or asking them to listen to us, but more of equality and respect. "The third is to focus on problem-oriented and results-oriented. "Our non-mechanical transportation when going abroad is more based on the needs of the recipient countries, such as solving the problem of children's schooling and cataract surgery, which are all real solutions to the urgent needs in people's lives. problem. "As a result, the poverty reduction experience and brand projects that have achieved good results in China have gradually formed international influence overseas.

;

;The Love Package Project, launched in 2009, is the largest domestic project of the China Rural Development Foundation. One of the most popular and influential projects. The project builds a public welfare platform and distributes packages to children in underdeveloped areas to provide one-on-one care and inspire children's childhood dreams. From the launch of the project to the end of 2022, the Love Package Project A total of 869 million yuan of social donations have been received in China, benefiting nearly 8 million students in 31 provinces (autonomous regions and municipalities) across the country.

;

;In response to the “Belt and Road” initiative, in February 2019 The China Rural Development Foundation and Alibaba Philanthropy jointly launched the Panda Pack Project, which brought the PandaPack Project from China to countries along the “Belt and Road”. As of the end of 2022, the international PandaPack Project has raised more than 139 million yuan, benefiting 14 countries including Myanmar, Nepal, Ethiopia, Cambodia, Laos, Pakistan, Namibia, Uganda, Mongolia, Philippines, Zimbabwe, South Sudan, Burundi, Chad, etc., with more than 1.184 million beneficiaries. International Love Package The project has also become one of the largest overseas public welfare projects implemented by Chinese social organizations, and has become a representative of the people-to-people bonds of the "Belt and Road Initiative". The project won the Best Reduction Award in the "Second Global Poverty Reduction Case Collection" awarded by the United Nations system in 2021. "Poverty Cases".

;

;Since 2017, the Red Cross Foundation of China, relying on the Silk Road Philanthropy Fund, has also begun to optimize the supply of humanitarian services in countries along the "Belt and Road" and provide humanitarian assistance to people in urgent humanitarian needs along the routes. As of the end of June 2023, a total of nearly 70 million yuan has been invested to fund international humanitarian assistance projects in 26 countries in Asia and Africa. The funding areas include medical assistance, health intervention, community development, relief and disaster relief, volunteer services, etc. The number of beneficiaries 62,669 people. Among them, the international free lunch project has benefited 7,197 students in 6 countries: Kenya, Uganda, Malawi, Nigeria, Tanzania and Ethiopia, helped 1,105 children return to school, and created employment for hundreds of African women. Nemy Matinde, one of the students who was once aided, returned to a community school to become a teacher after graduating from university. He said: "Chinese public welfare organizations helped me, so I also want to use my own power to help more children here, so that They have access to education. ”

;

;In the field of global biodiversity and ecological environmental protection, more and more Chinese organizations are gradually practicing. The Global Environmental Institute (GEI), founded in 2004, is one of the strongest in the country. , a large-scale grassroots environmental non-governmental organization, committed to using market mechanisms and policy suggestions to solve environmental problems. Since its establishment, GEI has focused on promoting international cooperation on environment, energy and other issues from a local perspective, especially South-South cooperation. As early as In 2005, GEI brought China's mature and reliable biogas technology to Sri Lanka and to Laos five years later. GEI has been carrying out projects in the fields of biodiversity protection, global climate change, energy efficiency and other fields for many years. In 2011, all projects were completed "Going Global". From 2012 to 2019, its projects have covered Myanmar, Mongolia, Laos, Vietnam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Ghana, Cameroon, the Republic of Congo and many other countries.

;

;;Walk on a tightrope. OK;

;

;The “Belt and Road” initiative has led more Chinese social organizations to go global, but this decade is only the first step. Professor Huang Haoming said that Chinese social organizations still have to go global. Faced with many challenges, the legal basis is insufficient from a macro perspective and policy support is relatively lagging behind.

;

;After the “Belt and Road” initiative was proposed in 2013, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council successively issued a series of opinions and notices to encourage social organizations to participate in international Non-governmental organization activities and international exchanges. The promulgation of the Charity Law of the People's Republic of China in 2016 ushered in the era of "good" governance in accordance with the law. There are some provisions related to overseas donations, but there are no provisions related to the "going global" of charitable public welfare organizations. In the same year, the "Law of the People's Republic of China on the Administration of Activities of Overseas Non-Governmental Organizations in the Territory" was passed and implemented, regulating and guiding the exchanges and cooperation of overseas non-governmental organizations in China. There are laws to follow for overseas non-governmental organizations to carry out activities in China, and Chinese non-governmental organizations Organizations have gone global but are still wandering in the legal void.

;

;At the beginning of 2023, the National People's Congress of China published the "Charity Law ;(;Revised Draft;);", facing the society The public is soliciting opinions. An article has been added to the revised draft: “The state encourages international charitable exchanges. Charitable organizations that accept overseas charitable donations or cooperate with overseas organizations or individuals to carry out charitable activities must go through approval or filing procedures in accordance with relevant national regulations. "Although international exchange terms have been added, there are no specific provisions on international cooperation and overseas project development.

;

;Funding is another major factor that restricts Chinese public welfare organizations from going global. Take the China Rural Development Foundation as an example For example, the total donation income in 2022 is 1.159 billion yuan, and international projects will be 31.0095 million yuan, accounting for less than 3%. International project funds come from the public, enterprises, foundations and government departments, of which public donations account for the bulk, accounting for 70%, and others Foundations and enterprises each account for 10%. Government donations include grants from Chinese embassies and consulates abroad and grants from the Global Development and South-South Cooperation Fund, accounting for only about ;5%;.

; < p>; Judging from the experience of other countries, when international non-governmental organizations carry out projects overseas, government overseas aid funds are an important source. "Compared with other countries, our government's purchase funds for social organizations are still relatively small," Professor Huang Haoming said, “For example, about 20% of the U.S.’s annual foreign aid funds are implemented through their non-governmental organizations, which is a huge amount. "

;

;In August 2021, the China International Development Cooperation Agency, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the Ministry of Commerce issued the "Foreign Aid Management Measures", which pointed out that South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund projects should be carried out, that is, using the South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund to support Projects implemented by international organizations, social organizations, think tanks, etc. This sends a positive signal for the government to implement foreign aid through social organizations, but it is only the beginning.

;

;Talent is also a challenge for Chinese social organizations to go global. A 2021 study on "Chinese Social Organizations' Participation in the 'Belt and Road' Construction" conducted by Yang Li, Director of the International NGO and Foundation Research Center of Beijing Normal University, showed that social organizations generally lack talents with rich foreign-related work experience. 124 companies participated in the survey Institutions, 50% of institutions have no relevant foreign-related talents, and less than 13% of institutions have 7 or more foreign-related talents.

;

;In Professor Huang Haoming’s view, international talents are not only foreign language skills, but also more important It is comprehensive quality. There are four key and difficult points, one is to have an international vision, the other is to understand international rules, the third is to have the ability to resist risks, and the fourth is to have strong negotiation skills. "When carrying out projects overseas, you need to deal with local people. , the working environment is also full of uncertainty and requires strong adaptability. " Professor Huang Haoming said.

;

;;Steady the first step and help peers take the first step;

;

;Earlier, the China Rural Development Foundation "went global" "We encountered various challenges and problems. For example, when we were working as the first hospital in Sudan, there was a problem with customs clearance of materials, which ultimately resulted in demurrage fees. Later, looking back, the reason was mainly because we were not familiar with the customs, laws and regulations of the other country. . Accordingly, with the funding of the Asia Foundation, the China Rural Development Foundation compiled an "Operation Manual for Chinese Non-Governmental Organizations Going Global" to share the key points of going global with other organizations to help them go global more smoothly. At the same time, the China Rural Development Foundation actively organizes and participates in various "going global" activities, such as the Chinese Social Organizations Going Abroad Symposium, the "Belt and Road" Chinese Enterprises Overseas Philanthropy Road Seminar, the China-Egypt Non-Governmental Organization Webinar, and the China Rural Development Foundation. non-forums, etc., to share the challenges and experiences of going global and build a collaborative network.

;

;As China’s first non-governmental organization in the environmental field to “go global” to carry out overseas projects, the Global Environment Institute (GEI), at the Ford Foundation In 2016, with the funding of "Going Global", the experience, challenges and thinking of "Going Global" were also researched, and the report "Chinese Non-Governmental Organizations "Going Global": Current Situation, Challenges and Policy Recommendations" was released, which focused on the relationship between Chinese and foreign non-governmental organizations and the government, Case references for enterprises to carry out cooperation projects provide reference for peers. Then, in 2017, GEI joined hands with experts from different fields to hold a "Going Global" symposium for Chinese non-governmental organizations to discuss and share experiences in participating in international affairs.

;

; In May 2021, Amity Foundation Secretary-General Ling Chunxiang was successfully elected as a director of the International Confederation of Voluntary Agencies (ICVA). This marks that Amity has further accumulated experience in deeply participating in international governance. To this end, Amity actively cooperates with the International Relations of Renmin University of China Associate Professor Xu Ying of the college co-wrote the article "Seizing International Political Opportunities - The Path of Internationalization of Chinese Social Organizations", introducing Amity's participation in the United Nations humanitarian aid system by joining ICVA and its significance to the internationalization of Chinese social organizations. Other peers provide reference.

;

;Everything is still in its infancy, and mutual help and teamwork are particularly important. Chen Hongtao, Secretary-General of the China Rural Development Foundation, said: "Although the international construction of the China Rural Development Foundation is currently Some progress and results have been achieved, but compared with some mature international institutions, there is a relatively large gap in the number of countries covered overseas, project scale, team capabilities, international influence, etc. In the future, we hope to strengthen learning and exchanges , while linking more social forces and joining hands with more social organizations to go global. ”

;

;In addition to large institutions that have explored internationalization earlier, Professor Huang Haoming has also observed in recent years that some local institutions have begun to take the first step. Their exploration may provide reference for other places and even the country. “Yunnan takes advantage of its border, and the Yunnan Provincial Foreign Affairs Office, Yunnan Provincial Department of Commerce, Yunnan Provincial Promotion Association and other departments and social organizations have collaborated to form a very good communication mechanism. This is rare in the country. "Professor Huang Haoming said, "When talking about 'going out' in the past, most people talked about institutions in Beijing. In recent years, institutions such as Shenzhen International Exchange and Cooperation Foundation, Shanghai Fosun Foundation, Sichuan Haihui Poverty Alleviation Center, Tibet Charity Yuan Foundation, Zhejiang Gongyang Association, etc. are also doing very distinctive things. ”

;

;The “14th Five-Year Plan for the Development of Social Organizations” issued by the Ministry of Civil Affairs in 2021 pointed out that it is necessary to steadily implement the “going out” of social organizations, carry out overseas cooperation in an orderly manner, and enhance the participation of our country’s social organizations in global governance. ability to improve the influence of Chinese culture and China's "soft power." The word "stable" may be the current attitude of China's public welfare institutions in "going out". Only by stabilizing the first step can we take a more stable step in the future. next step.

;How much impact will a video of more than ten seconds have on a 100-billion-dollar listed company?

;

;Many investors in Tsingtao Beer (600600.SH) have been worried about this throughout the weekend.

;

;A video posted online showed a male employee wearing blue overalls and a safety helmet digging into a suspected raw material warehouse to urinate. The video said it happened at Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 Factory. After the market closed on October 20, this video was widely circulated on the Internet and became a hot search topic.

;

;The Market Supervision and Administration Bureau of Pingdu City, where Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 is located, confirmed to the 21st Century Business Herald reporter that the malt involved has been sealed and the investigation of the incident is still ongoing. A person from Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 responded to a reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald that the incident in the online video was not in the warehouse of No. 3 Beer, and the person involved was not an employee of No. 3 Beer.

;

;This statement has not been officially confirmed by Tsingtao Beer. A reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald noticed that the clothes of the person involved in the online video were similar to the work clothes of Tsingtao Brewery No. 3. Regarding the progress of the investigation of the incident, a reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald contacted the Tsingtao Brewery Board Secretary Office several times over the weekend, but was unable to get through as of press time.

;

;Food safety is a top priority in the beverage industry. Domestic beer giants have rarely encountered such major public opinion in recent years. Many investors have questioned on platforms such as Stock Bar: How can the production safety control capabilities of large wine companies be weak? Could this be some kind of business war "script"?

;

;The final investigation results will lead to different directions. If it is confirmed that the incident is related to the Tsingtao Brewery factory or employees, it means that there are major problems with the internal control system of this century-old beer giant. If it is confirmed that the incident was committed by a third-party supplier and did not occur within the Tsingtao Brewery factory, Tsingtao Brewery's responsibility will be relatively reduced, but it will still expose its omissions in the entire chain of supplier control.

;

;Coinciding with the weakening growth momentum of domestic beer since the third quarter, Tsingtao Beer’s stock price has continued to fall recently. How to characterize this incident and how to deal with it later will test the wisdom of the parties involved.

;

;Pingdu Municipal Supervision Bureau: The malt involved has been sealed

;

;Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 said: It is not in the warehouse and is not a Tsingtao Brewery employee

;

;According to the video, The urination incident occurred at Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 Factory.

;

;Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 is located in Pingdu City, a subsidiary of Qingdao City, more than 100 kilometers away from Qingdao City. It was formerly known as Beihai Brewery. It was founded in 1986 and had a production capacity of less than 10,000 when it was built. However, after years of capacity transformation, especially in recent years, the scale has continued to increase.

;

;An article on Tsingtao Beer’s official WeChat ID earlier this year mentioned: In the past five years, Tsingtao Beer Plant No. 3 has undergone multiple upgrades, with annual production capacity jumping from 750,000 kiloliters in 2018 to 2022. 1.2 million kiloliters, making it a world-class factory. Not only that, Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 is also the leader of Tsingtao Beer Intelligent Industrial Park, which gathers 11 industrial chain supporting enterprises and is the largest clustered, intelligent, garden-style industrial park in the global industrial chain.

;

;Why do such very elementary production safety incidents occur in a world-class factory? Some investors pointed out that in a factory of this size, the bathroom must be standard and not far from the workplace. Why would employees go to all the trouble to go into the raw material warehouse to urinate, and even be caught on video?

;

;On October 22, a person from the Third Tsingtao Brewery Factory responded to a reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald that the video of an employee urinating online was not at the raw material warehouse of the Third Factory, and the person involved was not an employee of Tsingtao Brewery. , the specific circumstances of the incident are still under investigation.

;

; A reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald contacted the Pingdu Municipal Market Supervision Bureau on October 21. A person from the Pingdu Municipal Supervision Bureau told the reporter that it was certain that the malt involved had been sealed, but the specifics of the incident The results of the investigation are yet to be officially announced.

;

;People from the Municipal Supervision Bureau did not respond to whether the incident was committed by employees of Tsingtao Brewery No. 3.

;

;21st Century Business Herald compared the photos on the official account of Tsingtao Brewery Factory No. 3 and noticed that the work clothes of employees at Tsingtao Brewery Factory No. 3 are dark blue, with yellow hats, and there are light-colored strips on the back of the work clothes, which is consistent with The people involved in the video posted online were wearing similar clothes. However, due to insufficient clarity, it is difficult to determine whether the person involved in the video was wearing work clothes from Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 Factory.

;

;;

;

;;

;

;(Comparison of the work clothes of Tsingtao Beer Factory No. 3 and the clothing of the person involved in the online video)

;

;Tsingtao Beer officials issued a situation statement on the evening of October 20: In response to the Tsingtao Beer Factory No. 3 that appeared online on October 19 Our company attaches great importance to the relevant video and immediately reported it to the public security organs, who have intervened in the investigation. At present, this batch of malt has been completely sealed. Our company continues to increase management efforts to ensure product quality, and welcomes consumer supervision.

;

;Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 produces main brand products

;

;Consumption intention will be affected in the short term

;

;What netizens are worried about is: has similar incidents happened before? Budweiser has twice made false alarms due to similar news.

;

;In May 2017, a video of female workers manually pouring Budweiser beer was widely circulated.  After Budweiser reported the case, an investigation found that the video was fake wine made from recycled Budweiser beer cans from a domestic copycat brewery.

;

;In July 2020, news circulated on the domestic Internet that "an employee of Budweiser beer has peed in it for many years." It was later discovered that the news was "fake news" from an external spoof website. Budweiser quickly refuted the rumors on its domestic platform, saying that the rumors were "malicious slander of the company's products" and "this matter is purely fabricated."

;

;“We have strict production procedures. After the malt enters our production line, it will go through various processes such as cleaning, sterilization, disinfection, and fermentation. Consumers should rest assured.” The aforementioned person from the third Tsingtao Brewery Factory said 21st Century Business Herald reporter emphasized.

;

;Some industry insiders also told reporters that malt is generally cleaned to remove impurities before brewing, and industrial canned beer is also sterilized, which will most likely not affect the drinking safety of the beer. However, there are also draft beer products on the market that are not sterilized and only fermented at low temperatures. The purpose is to retain more flavor. Such products are difficult to preserve and have a short shelf life.

;

;It is widely circulated on the Internet that Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 mainly produces non-Tsingtao beer brands such as Guoli and Red Snow Dragon. They are not major brands on the market. Most locals in Qingdao do not drink them and they mainly sell them to other places. , some of which brands have been discontinued.

;

;However, a reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald learned that Tsingtao Brewery No. 3 also produces main brand products such as Classic 1903. Classic 1903 is one of the representative products of Tsingtao Beer’s product upgrade in recent years. It has a shelf life of 365 days and theoretically also requires sterilization.

;

;However, the overwhelming news will still have an impact on some consumers' willingness to consume.  

;

;A reporter from the 21st Century Business Herald noticed that a netizen posted a post saying that he habitually purchased an extra box of Tsingtao beer, but after thinking of the news, he finally chose to delete it.

;

;Some consumers asked the customer service of Tsingtao Beer flagship store whether the products come from the third factory? Customer service responded that it was not clear which factory the product came from. Since the product is shipped randomly from the warehouse, it cannot be designated.

;

;As of press time on the afternoon of the 22nd, Tsingtao Brewery and the Pingdu Municipal Supervision Bureau have not disclosed the results of their investigation into the incident.

;

;If it is finally confirmed that he is an employee of Tsingtao Beer or that the incident occurred in a Tsingtao Beer factory, it means that Tsingtao Beer’s internal control system will face torture. If the incident is confirmed to be the behavior of a third party, Tsingtao Beer's responsibility can be reduced, but there are still omissions in Tsingtao Beer's full-chain production control.

;

;"If the incident is true, then this incident is a very low-level mistake. As a listed company and the oldest leading beer company in China, Tsingtao Beer reflects the internal management and quality control of Tsingtao Beer The lack of the system will definitely have some impact on the entire image of Tsingtao Beer and its performance in the capital market." Zhu Danpeng, vice president of the Guangdong Provincial Food Safety Promotion Association, told the 21st Century Business Herald reporter.

;

;The third quarter performance is the focus

;

;As the relevant video was widely circulated after the market closed on October 20, Tsingtao Beer’s stock price was not affected and closed with a slight increase on the 20th. official. Investors are watching how the market will react after the market opens on Monday, the 23rd.

;

;Compared with this unexpected incident, the impact of the recent weakening of beer consumption sentiment on major beer stocks deserves more attention from investors.

;

;After offline opening this year, the beer industry ushered in a year of recovery. The beer output of designated enterprises across the country increased by 7% year-on-year in the first half of the year, especially in March and April, based on a low base in the same period last year, the year-on-year growth was as high as 20%.

;

;As one of the industry leaders, Tsingtao Beer has enjoyed the dividends of recovery. In the first half of this year, Tsingtao Brewery achieved operating income of 21.59 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 12%; net profit attributable to shareholders of listed companies was 3.43 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 20.1%. Tsingtao Beer's stock price hit a record high in April, exceeding 123 yuan per share.

;

;However, starting from June, the consumption enthusiasm in the beer market began to decline. First, in June, the beer production of designated enterprises across the country increased by only 1.6% year-on-year. In the summer of July and August, under the dual influence of heavy rains in the north and typhoons in the south, beer consumption during the peak season was not as expected. Coupled with the impact of the high base in the same period last year, The beer output of designated enterprises across the country has declined, with year-on-year declines of 3.4% and 5.8% respectively.

;

;In September, beer consumption became even weaker. According to data from the National Bureau of Statistics, the beer output of designated enterprises across the country in September was 2.866 million liters, a year-on-year decrease of 8%. The cumulative output in the first nine months was 29.933 million liters, a year-on-year increase of 2.1%.    

;

;Tsingtao Beer’s stock price has been declining since April. As of last week, the stock price was as low as just over 80 yuan. It has fallen by more than 30% in less than half a year, which is a new low in the past year.

;

;Tsingtao Beer will disclose its third quarter report on the evening of October 27. As of the close of trading on the 20th, Tsingtao Beer’s market value was approximately 110.6 billion yuan.

;

;Austin has been in "trouble" recently.

;

;It has been more than a thousand days since Austin took office as Defense Secretary on January 20, 2021. The Republican Party is quite dissatisfied with Austin's "political performance" so far, and recently even publicly proposed to reduce his annual salary from US$220,000 to US$1. The U.S. House of Representatives recently passed amendments to the relevant bill.

;

;Republican Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, who proposed the amendment, said fiercely in the House of Representatives: "Austin did not perform his job responsibilities. In fact, he is destroying our military."

;

;What is going on?

;

;;

;

;The Republican Party is quite dissatisfied with Austin's "political performance" so far. (Yao Yijiang/Photo)

;

;;Annual salary;;cut to US$1;

;

;As the top civilian military leader in the Biden administration, Austin came under fire from Republican lawmakers in the House.

;

;On September 27, the U.S. House of Representatives voted to approve an amendment proposed by Georgia Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene to replace Defense Secretary Austin’s Annual salary cut to $1.

;

;"Secretary Austin botched the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan, resulting in the deaths of thirteen U.S. soldiers while abandoning U.S. civilians and military equipment." Green on social media "During Austin's tenure," it reads, "there was no recruiting, but instead a focus on purging the military through purported power."

;

;According to the House Rules Committee , Greene said in her amendment that she used the Holman rule, which "allows for changes in appropriations legislation to reduce the wages of specific federal employees or to lay off specific federal employees, or to cut specific programs."

;

;Lawmakers passed her amendment by voice vote, with Democrats not calling for a roll call vote because they expected the pay cut measure to fail. took control of the Senate, and Democrats opposed a defense budget bill crafted by House Republicans.

;

;"The Republican Party is just using some issues and the death of a few soldiers to attack President Biden." Zhou Yuanxi, an expert on international issues, told Southern Weekend reporters that recruitment is difficult It is a social problem in the United States, and the role played by a secretary of defense cannot be entirely blamed.

;

;Austin is the first African-American defense secretary in the United States, with an annual salary of more than $221,000. Austin pensions are estimated to be worth starting at $1.8 million.

;

;Even if Austin cuts his salary to $1, the impact on him will be "not too big."

;

;Austin and Biden have known each other for many years and are deeply trusted by the latter.

;

;The outside world generally believes that Austin has "AB side".

;

;Side A, when Austin was still a colonel, he was appointed commander of the 82nd Airborne Division. Because of his outstanding performance, Austin has many "firsts" in his resume. For example, the first African American Secretary of Defense; the first African American Army Deputy Chief of Staff; the first African American Central Command Commander...

;

;Austin’s military resume has a strong Middle Eastern flavor and he served as commander of the U.S. Central Command. Commanding the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq and the fight against the extremist organization "Islamic State" were the highlight moments of Austin's career.

;

;Biden once wrote an article emphasizing that Austin not only has rich experience, skills and strategies as a soldier, but also has diplomatic abilities. Calling Austin a "tested soldier and leader."

;

;"Biden does not regard the ability of the Secretary of Defense as the primary consideration." Yang Zhen, deputy director of the Northeast Asia Research Center of Shanghai University of Political Science and Law, believes that this often makes him "Playing minefields" in handling domestic and foreign affairs.  

;

;Austin's "B-side" is considered by the outside world to be the "three sins" required by the Republican Party to reduce his salary.

;

;"Secretary Austin is not doing his job. In fact, he is destroying our military." Green criticized Austin and said the current draft number is at "crisis levels." , if assistance continues to be provided to the Ukrainian conflict, "this will undoubtedly lead us to World War III."

;

;;"Crime";

;

;Currently, the difficulty in recruiting soldiers is the U.S. military One of the “old and difficult” problems we face. Draft numbers are down, suicide rates are up, and the cohesion of the military is plummeting.

;

;Among the five branches of the Department of Defense, only the Marine Corps and the Space Force have achieved their active duty recruitment goals for fiscal year 2023. The Army, Air Force, and Navy None of them achieved their goals.

;

;Although the U.S. military has adopted many innovative ways to encourage young people to join the military, including the Army reusing the slogan "Do your best" from the 1980s, the Air Force has relaxed Following previous tattoo and drug testing policies, the Navy introduced record financial incentives of up to $140,000. But in the end, these three services still failed to achieve their recruitment goals.

;

;"The United States has encountered various problems and dilemmas in recruiting troops, withdrawing troops from Afghanistan, and responding to Ukraine. Among these problems and dilemmas, a large number of Part of it is a waste of U.S. national power and reduces the U.S.’s international prestige." Yang Zhen said.

;

;At a time when recruitment is difficult, the U.S. Army will cut about 3,000 personnel, or about 10% of the number of special operations forces. Included in psychological operations, civil affairs, intelligence personnel, communications units, logistics and other support services.

;

;But Austin has not yet signed the final documents.

;

;Wisconsin Rep. Derek Van Orden expressed support for Greene's amendment, noting that suicide rates among active-duty service members and veterans are high in 2021. Thirteen soldiers died during the withdrawal from Afghanistan.

;

;Many outsiders believe that the withdrawal of troops from Afghanistan has become a "joke" in U.S. military history. The hasty retreat of U.S. forces and the chaos at Kabul airport resulted in the deaths of thirteen U.S. service members in the attack in Kabul. During this withdrawal, Austin was accused by public opinion of failing to properly handle this major military operation, which caused the US military to be in trouble.

;

;"Austin abandoned thousands of American citizens and allies to terrorists in Afghanistan. He should be directly responsible for this incident." Former US Navy SEAL Team member Van Orden said publicly.

;

;"The main contradiction currently facing the United States is the contradiction between the rising cost of maintaining hegemony and the gradually declining comprehensive national strength." Yang Zhen believes that "from At this point, Austin lacks the political wisdom and strategic vision required for this position."

;

;It is worth noting that the U.S. House of Representatives also pointed out that the United States has invested in Ukraine The huge amount of funds has failed to bring substantial strategic benefits to the country. Austin's failure to provide effective leadership on this issue has cast doubt on U.S. military policy.

;

;Since Russia launched the conflict against Ukraine in February 2022, the Biden administration, with the support of Congress, has provided nearly $75 billion in aid to Ukraine. Includes humanitarian, economic and military support. However, various opinion polls show that there is growing doubt in the United States about the need to continue providing additional assistance to Ukraine.

;

;Zhou Yuanxi believes that after Austin came to power, in the process of assisting Ukraine, an alliance of 54 countries was formed to jointly support Ukraine.

;

;;"The first bird is shot";

;

;On one side is the Republican Party The other side is the support of the Democrats.

;

;"Austin has played an important role in helping Ukraine and strengthening defense partnerships around the world." Minnesota Democratic Rep. Betty McCollum said of Austin defended his performance and said Democrats viewed the Republican pay cut proposal for Austin as a "political stunt."

;

;As ;As part of the debate over the fiscal 2024 defense appropriations bill;, Republican lawmakers approved multiple similar proposals to cut their Don't like the pay for DoD jobs.

;

;Many interviewed experts and scholars told Southern Weekend reporters that since the bill must pass the Democratic-controlled Senate and be signed by Biden, it is unlikely to be passed. But it marks yet another Republican rebuke of America’s current military leadership and reflects the country’s growing partisan divide.

;

;Zhou Yuanxi believes that cutting the salary of the Secretary of Defense is an emotional expression of the Republican Party’s opposition to Biden’s administration. The main purpose is to "disgust" Biden and pave the way for Trump's election.

;

;"This time the House of Representatives has adopted a tactic of clipping its wings. The target is directly at Biden, almost explicitly accusing him of improper employment." Yang Zhen believes that the House of Representatives believes that Austin is not up to the job, and destroying the U.S. armed forces is not an exaggeration. This is Biden's biggest problem.

;

;In August 2023, the results of a poll conducted by the American Gallup Consulting Company, a public opinion polling agency, showed that opinions between the Democratic Party and the Republican Party continue to diverge. It is difficult to reach consensus on most issues, and American politics is increasingly divided.

;

;Zhou Yuanxi believes that the fight between the Republican Party and the Democratic Party in the United States is to attack President Biden and the Democratic Party by finding the weaknesses of a person in such a sensitive position as the Secretary of Defense. In fact, this is the result of a struggle between the two parties.

;

;On the evening of September 28, the U.S. House of Representatives voted on four separate appropriation bills. The four appropriation bills involved defense, homeland security, agriculture, and the State Department respectively. and external affairs. Three bills related to defense, homeland security, and the State Department and Foreign Affairs were passed, while the bill related to agriculture was vetoed.

;

;What is noteworthy is that this budget dispute not only reflects the long-term contradictions between the Democratic Party and the Republican Party, but also creates a "superposition of contradictions" within the Republican Party, creating a complicated situation .

;

;"The dispute between the two parties has no bottom line." Yang Zhen analyzed that in the American political arena, the dispute between the two parties is the main theme, and the current security situation is not a problem for the United States. It is not optimistic. The opposition party's demand to reduce the salary of the Minister of Defense to US$1 is actually putting the interests of the party above the interests of the country. "This is a very dangerous sign."

;

;"To some Republicans, all Democrats are bad people, and vice versa." Dr. Todd Grande, a well-known American sociologist, once said Publicly stated, “This is a very simple and quite dangerous way of looking at the world.”

;

;On October 3, the U.S. House of Representatives dismissed the Republican Speaker of the House of Representatives. McCarthy's motion was voted on, and the result was a narrow vote of 216 in favor and 210 against, passing the motion to remove McCarthy. This also marked McCarthy as the first speaker of the House of Representatives to be voted out of office in the history of the United States.

;

;This recall incident has made American public opinion believe that the political struggle between the two parties will become more intense.

;

;Yang Zhen analyzed that this incident left several impressions on voters: first, Biden made a mistake in employing personnel, and his own ability to exercise power is questionable; second, Biden's ability to exercise power is questionable; It is because the senior officials of the Biden administration are not qualified for their jobs, and this administration must step down; third, all the security problems facing the United States today are due to the Biden administration.

;

;With the degree of political division and intensification of conflicts in the United States, the 2024 election year is destined to be full of uncertainty. Where will the future of American politics go? Still remains to be seen.
